com.pump.image.pixel

Class ScalingIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pump.image.pixel.ScalingIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PixelIterator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ScalingIterator.ByteScalingIterator, ScalingIterator.IntScalingIterator

    public abstract class ScalingIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements PixelIterator
    This iterator scales another iterator as it is being read.

    You cannot directly instantiate this class, but you can use the static get() methods or instantiate the two subclasses: IntScalingIterator or ByteScalingIterator.

    See Also:
    com.pump.image.pixel.ScalingDemo, "http://javagraphics.blogspot.com/2010/06/images-scaling-down.html"

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static ScalingIterator.IntScalingIterator get(IntPixelIterator i,
                                                     float scaledRatio)
        Returns a IntPixelIterator scaled to a specific ratio.

        If the ratio is 1.0: then this method returns the argument provided. Otherwise a new scaled iterator is returned.

        If the image type of the source image is one of the four supported int-based types (ARGB, ARGB_PRE, RGB, or BGR) then the new scaled iterator will also use that type. Otherwise the new iterator will use ARGB or RGB (depending on whether the source image is opaque or not).

        Parameters:
        i - the incoming source image data.
        scaledRatio - the ratio to scale to, where 1.0 is 100%, .5 is 50%, etc.
        Returns:
        a scaled iterator.

      • get

        public static ScalingIterator.ByteScalingIterator get(BytePixelIterator i,
                                                      float scaledRatio)
        Returns a BytePixelIterator scaled to a specific ratio.

        If the ratio is 1.0: then this method returns the argument provided. Otherwise a new scaled iterator is returned.

        If the image type of the source image is one of the four supported byte-based types (ABGR, ABGR_PRE, BGR, or GRAY) then the new scaled iterator will also use that type. Otherwise the new iterator will use ABGR or BGR (depending on whether the source image is opaque or not).

        Parameters:
        i - the incoming source image data.
        scaledRatio - the ratio to scale to, where 1.0 is 100%, .5 is 50%, etc.
        Returns:
        a scaled iterator.

      • get

        public static PixelIterator get(PixelIterator i,
                                float scaledRatio)
        Returns a PixelIterator scaled to a specific ratio.

        If the ratio is 1.0: then this method returns the argument provided. Otherwise a new scaled iterator is returned.

        If the image type of the source image is one of the eight supported types: then the new scaled iterator will also use that type. Otherwise the new iterator will use ABGR / BGR (for bytes) or ARGB / RGB (for ints).

        Parameters:
        i - the incoming source image data.
        scaledRatio - the ratio to scale to, where 1.0 is 100%, .5 is 50%, etc.
        Returns:
        a scaled iterator.

      • isSupportedIntType

        protected static boolean isSupportedIntType(int type)
        Checks the incoming image type against the 4 int types this class supports.

      • isSupportedByteType

        protected static boolean isSupportedByteType(int type)
        Checks the incoming image type against the 4 byte types this class supports.

      • get

        public static IntPixelIterator get(IntPixelIterator i,
                                   int newWidth,
                                   int newHeight)
        Returns a IntPixelIterator with a fixed width and height.

        If the source image is already the width and height specified: then this method returns the argument provided. Otherwise a new scaled iterator is returned.

        If the image type of the source image is one of the four supported int-based types (ARGB, ARGB_PRE, RGB, or BGR) then the new scaled iterator will also use that type. Otherwise the new iterator will use ARGB or RGB (depending on whether the source image is opaque or not).

        Parameters:
        i - the incoming source image data.
        newWidth - the new width.
        newHeight - the new height.
        Returns:
        an iterator that uses the width and height specified.

      • get

        public static BytePixelIterator get(BytePixelIterator i,
                                    int newWidth,
                                    int newHeight)
        Returns a BytePixelIterator with a fixed width and height.

        If the source image is already the width and height specified: then this method returns the argument provided. Otherwise a new scaled iterator is returned.

        If the image type of the source image is one of the four supported byte-based types (ABGR, ABGR_PRE, BGR, or GRAY) then the new scaled iterator will also use that type. Otherwise the new iterator will use ABGR or BGR (depending on whether the source image is opaque or not).

        Parameters:
        i - the incoming source image data.
        newWidth - the new width.
        newHeight - the new height.
        Returns:
        an iterator that uses the width and height specified.

      • get

        public static PixelIterator get(PixelIterator i,
                                int newWidth,
                                int newHeight)
        Returns a PixelIterator with a fixed width and height.

        If the source image is already the width and height specified: then this method returns the argument provided. Otherwise a new scaled iterator is returned.

        If the image type of the source image is one of the eight supported types: then the new scaled iterator will also use that type. Otherwise the new iterator will use ABGR / BGR (for bytes) or ARGB / RGB (for ints).

        Parameters:
        i - the incoming source image data.
        newWidth - the new width.
        newHeight - the new height.
        Returns:
        an iterator that uses the width and height specified.

      • isOpaque

        public boolean isOpaque()
        Description copied from interface: PixelIterator
        Returns true if this image is guaranteed to be an opaque image. This has to do with the pixel type of this image and not its content. (For example: an image with an alpha channel that happens to be opaque may still return false.)
        Specified by:
        isOpaque in interface PixelIterator
